description: critic +‎ -ize; first element from Ancient Greek κριτικός (kritikós, “of or for judging, able to discern”), from κρίσις (krísis, “crisis”).

verbs.description: criticize (third-person singular simple present criticizes, present participle criticizing, simple past and past participle criticized) (transitive, intransitive)

examples: Synonyms: censure, pick at; see also Thesaurus:criticize
Hyponyms: find fault, shoot down, run down, trash out, fustigate, drub, excoriate
They criticized him for endangering people's lives.

entries.meaning: To evaluate (something), assessing its merits and faults.
